name: Dairy Goats Quiz | Other Domestic Animals | 15 Questions

questions.text: Goats are not a major source of milk worldwide.
questions.explanation:
False.

	According to some sources, worldwide, goats produce more milk than any other animal andmore people in the world drink goats' milk than cows' milk.

questions.text: What is the major difference between goat's milk and cow's milk?
questions.correct: Goat milk has smaller fat globules
questions.explanation:
Goat milk has smaller fat globules.

	Goats' milk has smaller fat globules than cows' milk. This makes it naturally homogenized and more easily digestible than cows' milk.

questions.text: How many teats does a dairy goat have?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Cows have four, but goats have only two.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a breed of dairy goat?
questions.explanation:
Boer.

	The Boer is a 'meat goat.'

questions.text: Which breed of dairy goat does not have outer ears and looks earless?
questions.explanation:
La Mancha.

	Many people ask if the ears have been cut off, but La Manchas are born this way.

questions.text: Which breed of dairy goat is characterized by long, droopy ears and a Roman nose?
questions.explanation:
Nubian.

	The Nubian is also the largest dairy breed.

questions.text: Which dairy breed is white or cream-colored?
questions.explanation:
Saanen.

	The Saanen thus doesn't do well in very hot, sunny climates- it can get sunburned!

questions.text: Which breed is the smallest dairy goat?
questions.explanation:
Nigerian Dwarf.

	The Nigerian Dwarf produces up to half a gallon of milk a day, despite its tiny size- about the size of a Labrador retriever. ADGA registration will be allowed in 2005.

questions.text: Despite its name, the Lamancha goat was not bred in Spain, but in which country?
questions.explanation:
USA.

	It was first bred in the 1920s, in California, and is primarily a dairy goat.

questions.text: A goat usually must be bred in order to produce milk.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The same is true of cows. No mammal normally produces milk without being bred first!

questions.text: What is a neutered (castrated) male goat called?
questions.explanation:
wether & a wether.

	Wethers make good pets- they lack the overpowering odor of the male buck!

questions.text: What would a US dairy farmer call a male goat?
questions.explanation:
buck.

	Goat people don't call the males 'billies.' A ram is a male sheep.

questions.text: What is an infection of the udder called?
questions.explanation:
mastitis.

	It is a common problem in milking animals.

questions.text: What is the approximate gestation period (time from mating to birth) of a goat?
questions.explanation:
5 months.

	148 days, to be more exact.

questions.text: What is is the 'first milk' that provides antibodies to the baby of a goat (or any other mammal, for that matter) called?
questions.explanation:
colostrum.

	It helps keep the babies free of disease.
